text: [Music]
One of the questions is why did the
virus spread initially here in the
United States and in Europe in in men
who are having sex with men and and IV
drug users and have heterosexual spread
occur here but to a lesser degree. But
in the developing world, you know, these
massive epidemics heterosexually, and
there's been a lot of questions about
that. Some people have postulated maybe
the viruses, which are different, the
viruses that circulate different parts
of the world. So maybe the viruses, you
know, perhaps were better adapted to to
heterosexual transmission in the
developing world. Other people have have
postulated it's because they were more
other sexually transmitted infections or
people's immune systems were activated.
But the answer is we really don't
understand why that is. But that being
said, the the the explosions of diseases
in some places in southern Africa, you
have, you know, 30 to 40% of the adults
infected, you know, and that's all
heterosexual transmission and and it
exploded from a time in southern Africa,
you know, 20 years ago when there was
almost no epidemic. So there clearly is
a different dynamic in those
places. Southern Africa is infected with
a clay sea virus. clay sea virus is also
the virus that infects um India um and
that area of the world. Um some people
have postulated that that particular
strain might be a strain that that
transmits better to heterosexuals but
somehow that's we've been unable to
prove that in a study. Um there have
been other things that have come out of
of South Africa that have been of
concern. There's been extreme
drugresistant tuberculosis that's been
kind of a super strain. There's also
been numaccoal disease which is a type
of common pneumonia that's been
resistant to antibiotics. And one point
that that's important to think about
about that once upon a time we thought
about you know health being something
that's local. Today health is not local.
Health is global. We have to worry about
you know epidemics and disease and
antibiotic usage anywhere in the world
because people are moving viruses are
moving all the times. And so it points
out the importance of really
understanding and working in these parts
of the world. You know, if I mean both
for the good of doing the right thing
for those places, but also for the
importance of protecting us.
